briefdescription.para: OnSize() is called when the panel is resized.

detaileddescription.para: AS: OnPaint( ) is called during the normal course of completing a repaint operation.
This handles just generic mouse events. Then, based on our current state, we forward the mouse events to various interested parties.

briefdescription.para: Should handle the case when the mouse capture is lost.
Filter captured keys typed into LabelTracks.
AS: This gets called on our wx timer events.

detaileddescription.para: This method overrides Refresh() of wxWindow so that the boolean play indictaor can be set to false, so that an old play indicator that is no longer there won't get XORed (to erase it), thus redrawing it on the TrackPanel

briefdescription.para: Displays the bounds of the selection in the status bar.

detaileddescription.para: Gets the pointer to the AudacityProject that goes with this track panel.

The following method moves to the previous track selecting and unselecting depending if you are on the start of a block or not. Todo
Merge related methods, TrackPanel::OnPrevTrack and TrackPanel::OnNextTrack.
The following method moves to the next track, selecting and unselecting depending if you are on the start of a block or not.

briefdescription.para: Determines if the a modal tool is active.
Populates the track pop-down menu with the common set of initial items.

detaileddescription.para:
Ensures that all pop-down menus start with Name, and the commands for moving the track around, via a single set of c ode.
menu
the menu to add the commands to.

Used to determine whether it is safe or not to perform certain edits at the moment.
true if audio is being recorded or is playing.

briefdescription.para: Event has happened on a track and it has been determined to be a label track.

briefdescription.para: draws the green line on the tracks to show playback position

detaileddescription.para: We check on each timer tick to see if we need to scroll. Scrolling is handled by mListener, which is an interface to the window TrackPanel is embedded in.

If we are in multimode, looks at the type of track and where we are on it to determine what object we are hovering over and hence what tool to use.
pTtb
- A pointer to the tools tool bar
event
- Mouse event, with info about position and what mouse buttons are down.
method that tells us if the mouse event landed on an envelope boundary.
method that tells us if the mouse event landed on an editable sample
method that tells us if the mouse event landed on a time-slider that allows us to time shift the sequence.
This method handles various ways of starting and extending selections. These are the selections you make by clicking and dragging over a waveform.
AS: If we're dragging to extend a selection (or actually, if the screen is scrolling while you're selecting), we handle it here.
This method gets called when we're handling selection and the mouse was just clicked.

briefdescription.para: Reset our selection markers.
Extend the existing selection.

briefdescription.para: Select all tracks marked by the label track lt.

detaileddescription.para: When in the "label" (TrackInfo or vertical ruler), we can either vertical zoom or re-order tracks. Dont't change cursor/tip to zoom if display is not waveform (either linear of dB) or Spectrum

briefdescription.para: When in the resize area we can adjust size or relative size.

detaileddescription.para: When in a label track, find out if we've hit anything that would cause a cursor change.

detaileddescription.para: In this method we know what tool we are using, so set the cursor accordingly.
TrackPanel::HandleCursor( ) sets the cursor drawn at the mouse location. As this procedure checks which region the mouse is over, it is appropriate to establish the message in the status bar.
HandleEnvelope gets called when the user is changing the amplitude envelope on a track.
We've established we're a time track. send events for its envelope.
We've established we're a wave track. send events for its envelope.
The Envelope class actually handles things at the mouse event level, so we have to forward the events over. Envelope will then tell us whether or not we need to redraw.

briefdescription.para: Prepare for sliding.

detaileddescription.para: Slide tracks horizontally, or slide clips horizontally or vertically (e.g. moving clips between tracks).

This method takes care of our different zoom possibilities. It is possible for a user to just "zoom in" or "zoom out," but it is also possible for a user to drag and select an area that he or she wants to be zoomed in on. We use mZoomStart and mZoomEnd to track the beggining and end of such a zoom area. Note that the ViewInfo member mViewInfo actually keeps track of our zoom constant, so we achieve zooming by altering the zoom constant and forcing a refresh.

briefdescription.para: Zoom button down, record the position.
Zoom drag.
Zoom button up.

detaileddescription.para: This actually sets the Zoom value when you're done doing a drag zoom.

This handles normal Zoom In/Out, if you just clicked; IOW, if you were NOT dragging to zoom an area. Todo
MAGIC NUMBER: We've got several in this method.
Vertical zooming (triggered by clicking in the vertical ruler)

briefdescription.para: VZoom click.
VZoom drag.

detaileddescription.para:
VZoom Button up. There are three cases:
Drag-zooming; we already have a min and max
Zoom out; ensure we don't go too small.
Zoom in; ensure we don't go too large.

Determines if we can edit samples in a wave track. Also pops up warning messages in certain cases where we can't.
true if we can edit the samples, false otherwise.
This handles adjusting individual samples by hand using the draw tool(s)

There are several member data structure for handling drawing:
mDrawingTrack: keeps track of which track you clicked down on, so drawing doesn't jump to a NEW track
mDrawingTrackTop: The top position of the drawing trackmakes drawing easier.
mDrawingStartSample: The sample you clicked down on, so that you can hold it steady
mDrawingLastDragSample: When drag-drawing, this keeps track of the last sample you dragged over, so it can smoothly redraw samples that got skipped over
mDrawingLastDragSampleValue: The value of the last
We're in a track view and zoomed enough to see the samples. Someone has just clicked the mouse. What do we do?

xrefdescription.para: Should mCapturedTrack take the place of mDrawingTrack??

briefdescription.para: Handle mouse wheel rotation (for zoom in/out, vertical and horizontal scrolling)

detaileddescription.para: ButtonDown means they just clicked and haven't released yet. We use this opportunity to save which track they clicked on, and the initial height of the track, so as they drag we can update the track size.

Resize dragging means that the mouse button IS down and has moved from its initial location. By the time we get here, we have already received a ButtonDown() event and saved the track being resized in mCapturedTrack.

This happens when the button is released from a drag. Since we actually took care of resizing the track when we got drag events, all we have to do here is clean up. We also modify the undo state (the action doesn't become undo-able, but it gets merged with the previous undo-able event).

HandleResize gets called when:
A mouse-down event occurs in the "resize region" of a track, i.e. to change its vertical height.
A mouse event occurs and mIsResizing==true (i.e. while the resize is going on)
This handles when the user clicks on the "Label" area of a track, ie the part with all the buttons and the drop down menu, etc.
The user is dragging one of the tracks: change the track order accordingly
Figure out how far the user must drag the mouse up or down before the track will swap with the one above or below

detaileddescription.para: Makes our Parent (well, whoever is listening to us) push their state. this causes application state to be preserved on a stack for undo ops.

briefdescription.para: Move a track up, down, to top or to bottom.

detaileddescription.para: This only applies to MIDI tracks. Presumably, it shifts the whole sequence by an octave.

Set the Display mode based on the menu choice in the Track Menu. Note that gModes MUST BE IN THE SAME ORDER AS THE MENU CHOICES!! const wxChar *gModes[] = { wxT("waveform"), wxT("waveformDB"), wxT("spectrum"), wxT("pitch") };

briefdescription.para: Puts a check mark at a given position in a menu.

detaileddescription.para: Sets the sample rate for a track, and if it is linked to another track, that one as well.
This method handles the selection from the Rate submenu of the track menu, except for "Other" (/see OnRateOther).

xrefdescription.para: Make a real dialog box out of this!!

detaileddescription.para: Handles the selection from the Format submenu of the track menu.

Determines which track is under the mouse
mouseX
- mouse X position.
mouseY
- mouse Y position.
label

link

This finds the rectangle of a given track, either the of the label 'adornment' or the track itself
Draw the actual track areas. We only draw the borders and the little buttons and menues and whatnot here, the actual contents of each track are drawn by the TrackArtist.

Draws 'Everything else'. In particular it draws:
Drop shadow for tracks and vertical rulers.
Zooming Indicators.
Fills in space below the tracks.
Draw zooming indicator that shows the region that will be zoomed into when the user clicks and drags with a zoom cursor. Handles both vertical and horizontal zooming.

detaileddescription.para: Remembers the track we clicked on and why we captured it. We also use this method to clear the record of the captured track, passing NULL as the track.

briefdescription.para: The TrackPanel class coordinates updates and operations on the main part of the screen which contains multiple tracks.

detaileddescription.para: It uses many other classes, but in particular it uses the TrackInfo class to draw the controls area on the left of a track, and the TrackArtist class to draw the actual waveforms.
Note that in some of the older code here, e.g., GetLabelWidth(), "Label" means the TrackInfo plus the vertical ruler. Confusing relative to LabelTrack labels.
The TrackPanel manages multiple tracks and their TrackInfos.
Note that with stereo tracks there will be one TrackInfo being used by two wavetracks.
